TITLE: Former U.S. Rep. Eddie Bernice Johnson dies at 88

TITLE: From blizzards to torrential rain, extreme weather dominates across the U.S.
SUMMARY: The severe weather has canceled hundreds of flights, knocked out power for hundreds of thousands of households and disrupted campaigning in Iowa ahead of Monday's caucuses.

TITLE: John Kerry to step down after 3 years as Biden's top climate diplomat
SUMMARY: John Kerry, who has led the Biden administration's international climate efforts, is leaving his role. He's been central to Biden's efforts to establish the U.S. as an international climate leader.

SUMMARY: Protesters on Saturday called for an end to U.S. funding for Israel and for Israel to be held accountable for what organizers say are violations of international law.

SUMMARY: Congressional leaders are preparing a stopgap bill to keep the federal government running into March and avoid a partial shutdown next week.

SUMMARY: Besides being first, Iowa's caucuses have marketed the element of surprise. Since their start in 1972, the caucuses' big story has most often been news because it caught many in the media off guard.

SUMMARY: Taiwan's vice president and candidate of the ruling Democratic Progressive Party, Lai Ching-te, will be the island's next leader. Tensions with Beijing seem poised to rise.

SUMMARY: North Korea fired a suspected intermediate-range ballistic missile toward the sea on Sunday, South Korea's military said.

TITLE: Opinion: Women with obesity are often restricted from IVF. That's discriminatory
SUMMARY: Despite the lack of medical evidence for doing so, fertility clinics bar women over a certain BMI from their services. One writer makes the case such limits are unfair and unscientific.

SUMMARY: Israel claims some achievements in more than three months of fighting since Hamas' Oct. 7 attack, but the Palestinian death toll has soared and the militant group still clings to power in Gaza.

SUMMARY: A scholar of Israeli history reflects on the killing of his daughter and 100 days of war in Israel and Gaza. NPR's Daniel Estrin met him Oct. 7 when the war began, and again now.

TITLE: The catastrophe in Gaza after 100 days of Israel-Hamas war, by the numbers
SUMMARY: Nearly 24,000 Palestinians have been killed since the conflict began on Oct. 7, a staggering toll. Satellite imagery suggests that up to 160,000 buildings have been damaged or destroyed.

TITLE: Charcuterie sold at Costco and Sam's Club is being linked to a salmonella outbreak
SUMMARY: The CDC says there have been at least 47 illnesses across 22 states tied to the outbreak, which officials believe is linked to charcuterie meat trays sold at the two wholesale stores.

TITLE: Jack Burke Jr., who was the oldest living Masters champion, dies at age 100
SUMMARY: In 1956, Burke staged the greatest comeback ever at Augusta National. He was a member of the World Golf Hall of Fame, won the PGA Championship and was equally skilled as a teacher.

TITLE: Alec Baldwin is indicted in fatal shooting of cinematographer after new gun analysis
SUMMARY: Special prosecutors brought the case before a grand jury in Santa Fe, New Mexico this week, months after receiving a new analysis of the gun that was used.

TITLE: 'Sports Illustrated' lays off most of its staff
SUMMARY: The union representing the magazine's staff said that SI's publisher plans to cut "a significant number, possibly all" of its union-represented staff.

TITLE: Driven to distraction: New rules recommend states steer clear of highway sign humor
SUMMARY: The Federal Highway Administration tells states to watch out for word play that can confuse drivers.

TITLE: Sen. Tim Scott plans to endorse Trump ahead of New Hampshire primary
SUMMARY: The South Carolina Republican, a prominent figure in Congress, dropped his own bid for president in November. Now Scott is throwing his support behind former President Donald Trump.

TITLE: What to know about this weekend's brutal cold front in the central and eastern U.S.
SUMMARY: A burst of arctic air is forecast to be warmer than last week. But nevertheless, the cold front will be expansive, bringing dangerous cold temperatures from Kansas to Pennsylvania.

TITLE: Ousted Florida Republican cleared of rape allegation but faces video voyeurism charge
SUMMARY: Police have asked prosecutors to charge the ousted chair Christian Ziegler with illegally video recording the sexual encounter he had with a female acquaintance on Oct. 2.

TITLE: The S&P 500 surges to a record high as hopes about the economy — and Big Tech — grow
SUMMARY: The index surged over 1% to hit a record high, surpassing the previous peak hit around two years ago, driven by big gains in large tech companies and by hopes about the economy.

TITLE: 'Sports Illustrated' to lay off most of its staff amid severed licensing deal
SUMMARY: The union representing the magazine's staff said that SI's publisher plans to cut "a significant number, possibly all" of its union-represented staff.

TITLE: It's cold and snowing in D.C. But the March for Life goes on — after Roe ends
SUMMARY: Marchers from across the country braved frigid temperatures and snow for the the 51st annual March for Life — the second since the end of <em>Roe v. Wade

TITLE: Mary Weiss, lead singer of The Shangri-Las, has died
SUMMARY: With the 1960s pop girl group, Weiss found fame as a 15-year-old. She died on Friday, according to her husband.

TITLE: Election-year politics threaten Senate border deal as Trump rallies opposition
SUMMARY: Senators are closing in on a bipartisan deal on the border and immigration. But vocal opposition from the hard right and former President Donald Trump is threatening to topple the compromise.

TITLE: Grand jury indictment against Alec Baldwin opens two paths for prosecutors
SUMMARY: Alec Baldwin once again is staring down a felony involuntary manslaughter charge after a grand jury indicted the actor in connection with the fatal 2021 shooting of a cinematographer.

TITLE: Women and children are the main victims of the Israel-Hamas war, UN says
SUMMARY: Women and children are the main victims in the Israel-Hamas war, with some 16,000 killed, according to the United Nations agency promoting gender equality.

TITLE: Israel's anti-war movement includes mothers of soldiers serving in Gaza
SUMMARY: A group of Israeli mothers, whose sons are fighting in Gaza, is calling to end the war. They hold a minority view, but draw inspiration from a successful protest by Israeli mothers in a previous war.

TITLE: Chris Christie dropped out. Where will his voters turn in the New Hampshire primary?
SUMMARY: One woman called herself a super volunteer for Christie. Another man hosted the former New Jersey governor in his home. New Hampshire voters who backed Christie have to decide how to vote on Tuesday.

TITLE: Israeli airstrike on Damascus killed at least 4 Iranian advisers, state media say
SUMMARY: An Israeli strike on the Syrian capital on Saturday destroyed a building used by the Iranian paramilitary Revolutionary Guard, killing at least four Iranians, Syrian and Iranian state media reported.

TITLE: As Houthi attacks on ships escalate, experts look to COVID supply chain lessons
SUMMARY: Shipping experts hope lessons learned during the COVID-19 pandemic, the Suez Canal disruption in 2021 and Somali pirate attacks more than a decade ago will mitigate widespread problems this time.

TITLE: Women and children are the main victims of the Israel-Hamas war, U.N. says
SUMMARY: Women and children are the main victims in the Israel-Hamas war, with some 16,000 killed, according to the United Nations agency promoting gender equality.

TITLE: Flour for Gaza to be shipped through the Israeli port in Ashdod, the White House says
SUMMARY: Humanitarian groups had called for Israel to open the port to help alleviate the food crisis. All of Gaza's 2.2 million residents are at imminent risk of famine, the U.N. warns.

TITLE: Israeli airstrike on Damascus killed at least 5 Iranian advisers, state media say
SUMMARY: A strike on the Syrian capital destroyed a building used by the Iranian paramilitary Revolutionary Guard,  Syrian and Iranian state media reported. One of those killed was a local Hezbollah commander

SUMMARY: Microsoft says hackers broke into its corporate email system and accessed the accounts of members of its leadership team, as well as those of employees on its cybersecurity and legal teams.

TITLE: NASA is looking for Ingenuity after losing contact with the Mars helicopter
SUMMARY: The helicopter stopped communicating with the Perseverance rover during a test flight. Trouble for the overachieving rotorcraft would cut short its new phase of otherworldly flight exploration.

TITLE: 121 potential gravesites found in a former Black cemetery at MacDill Air Force Base
SUMMARY: The Air Force plans to expand its search for gravesites in a former Black cemetery at the Florida base. Headstones at the Port Tampa Cemetery were removed during construction of the base in the 1930s.

TITLE: U.S. personnel are injured after Iranian-backed militants attacked an Iraq air base
SUMMARY: A "number" of U.S. personnel are being evaluated for traumatic brain injuries, the U.S. military said, after barrage of missiles and rockets targeted the Ain al-Asad base on Saturday evening.

TITLE: NASA finds Ingenuity after losing contact with the Mars helicopter
SUMMARY: The helicopter had stopped communicating with the Perseverance rover during a test flight. Trouble for the overachieving rotorcraft threatened to cut short its otherworldly flight exploration.

SUMMARY: Tens of thousands of people protested the far right in cities across Germany on Saturday, attending events with slogans such as "Never Again is Now," "Against Hate" and "Defend Democracy."

SUMMARY: Prime Minister Narendra Modi will help consecrate the unfinished temple on Monday, on the site of a 16th century mosque destroyed in 1992. Critics say the rushed ceremony is a political stunt.

TITLE: California governor sacks effort to limit tackle football for kids
SUMMARY: A California proposal to phase out tackle football for children under twelve came to a screeching halt when the governor stepped in and said he wouldn't support it.

SUMMARY: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu said Saturday that he "will not compromise on full Israeli control" over Gaza and that "this is contrary to a Palestinian state".

SUMMARY: The Palestinian death toll in Gaza from over three months of war between Israel and the territory's Hamas rulers has soared past 25,000, the Gaza Health Ministry said Sunday.

TITLE: The enduring appeal of the 'Sex and the City' tutu
SUMMARY: The white tulle skirt worn by Sarah Jessica Parker in the hit HBO TV series' opening credits has sold at auction for $52,000.

TITLE: Many killed in Russian-occupied Donetsk, as fire breaks out at Russian port
SUMMARY: At least 25 people were killed Sunday by shelling at a market on the outskirts of the city of Donetsk in Russian-occupied Ukraine, local officials reported Sunday.

SUMMARY: As a new year dawns, we asked our readers to send us their global wishes. Here's what they're hoping for.

TITLE: 'You gotta be tough': White evangelicals remain enthusiastic about Donald Trump
SUMMARY: One takeaway from Iowa's Republican caucuses: evangelicals show no signs of backing away from Donald Trump. But some say even a small shift could make a big difference in November.

TITLE: At least 25 were killed in the shelling of a market in Russian-occupied Ukraine
SUMMARY: Russian-installed authorities in Donetsk said that the shells had been fired by the Ukrainian military and called it a "terrorist attack."

TITLE: Much of the U.S. is still in the grip of icy weather that is blamed for 67 deaths
SUMMARY: The numbing cold is expected to ease in the coming days as water systems in Memphis and other Tennessee cities battle broken pipes that have caused boil-water notices.

SUMMARY: Billions of cicadas will emerge this spring across eastern and southern states as two broods arrive simultaneously for the first time in more than 200 years.

SUMMARY: Russian-installed authorities in Donetsk said that the shells had been fired by the Ukrainian military and called it a "terrorist attack."

TITLE: Palestinian death toll passes 25,000 as Israel announces the death of another hostage
SUMMARY: Since the war started on Oct. 7, 25,105 Palestinians have been killed in Gaza, while another 62,681 have been wounded, the Health Ministry in the Gaza Strip said.

SUMMARY: Days before the New Hampshire primary, Florida Gov. Ron DeSantis announced he's dropping his presidential bid after a second place finish in Iowa to former President Donald Trump.

SUMMARY: The numbing cold is expected to ease in the coming days as water systems in Memphis and other Tennessee cities battle broken pipes that have caused boil-water notices.

TITLE: Tara VanDerveer is now the winningest coach in college basketball history
SUMMARY: VanDerveer, in her 38th season as Stanford coach, passed Duke's Coach K's record. She's helped the women's sport come a long way since she started her college basketball career over 50 years ago.

TITLE: 2 Navy SEALs who went missing off Somalia's coast are dead, the U.S. military says
SUMMARY: After a 10-day search, the SEALs have not been found and their status is now deceased, U.S. Central Command said. They went missing during a U.S. operation to seize weapons headed for the Houthis.

TITLE: Much of the U.S. is still in the grip of icy weather that is blamed for 72 deaths
SUMMARY: The numbing cold is expected to ease in the coming days as water systems in Memphis and other Tennessee cities battle broken pipes that have caused boil-water notices.

TITLE: Sarah, the Duchess of York, diagnosed with skin cancer
SUMMARY: The melanoma was found after several moles were removed while she was undergoing reconstructive surgery after a mastectomy. Doctors are analyzing it to see if it was caught early.

TITLE: Landslide in mountainous southwestern China buries dozens of people
SUMMARY: The disaster struck in the early morning in the village of Liangshui in the northeastern part of Yunnan province. Rescue efforts were underway to find victims buried in houses, officials said.

TITLE: 10 questions about the New Hampshire primary, including, 'Can anyone beat Trump?'
SUMMARY: The state could be the last stand for Republicans who don't want Donald Trump to be their nominee again. There likely won't be another opportunity with such a moderate Republican electorate.

TITLE: If you donate DNA, what should scientists give in return? A 'pathbreaking' new model
SUMMARY: That's how a prominent medical ethicist describes a researcher's innovative plan to share study results with participants in Kenya.

TITLE: New Hampshire may be Nikki Haley's last chance to keep presidential hopes alive
SUMMARY: Haley is the only major candidate left facing former President Donald Trump. Even though she has her best polling numbers in N.H., which votes Tuesday, the rest of the calendar is an uphill battle.

TITLE: Proposed federal law would put limits on use of $50 billion in opioid settlements
SUMMARY: Lawmakers want to ensure the funds are actually used to fight the addiction crisis, not "as a piggy bank for other projects."

TITLE: Why Vice President Harris is going to Wisconsin today to talk about abortion
SUMMARY: The vice president is hitting the road to talk about reproductive freedom, an issue Democrats want to highlight in the 2024 election. Her first stop marks the 51st anniversary of <em>Roe v Wade.

TITLE: Much of U.S. still gripped by arctic weather as Memphis deals with broken water pipes
SUMMARY: Subfreezing conditions and treacherous roads have contributed to dozens of deaths this month across the U.S., where states as far south as Texas and Florida remain gripped by deadly arctic weather.

SUMMARY: The invasion of Ukraine hampered collaboration with Russian climate scientists. That's bad news for our collective ability to understand, and prepare for, a hotter planet.

SUMMARY: The Federal Aviation Administration is recommending that airlines visually inspect the door plugs of Boeing 737-900ER jets after some airlines reported unspecified issues with the bolts.

TITLE: Japan shuts down its SLIM moon lander in hopes it will restart someday
SUMMARY: The lander was powered down at 12% battery power — saving enough juice for a potential restart. Now Japan's space agency will see if its solar cell can give the lander any electricity.

SUMMARY: This Sunday, the Kansas City Chiefs and the Baltimore Ravens will clash in the AFC Championship Game, while the Detroit Lions will tangle with the San Francisco 49ers in the NFC Championship Game.

TITLE: Dave Eggers wins Newbery, Vashti Harrison wins Caldecott in 2024 kids' lit prizes
SUMMARY: The top honors in this year's children's book awards from the American Library Association lauded Dave Egger's The Eyes and the Impossible and Vashti Harrison's picture book Big

TITLE: In Washington state, pharmacists are poised to start prescribing abortion drugs

SUMMARY: Photos from Israel and Gaza show some of what the past week has looked like for people on the ground there as the conflict enters its fourth month.

SUMMARY: The temple inauguration marks the culmination of a decades-long dispute over a site Hindus believe is the birthplace of the god Ram. Critics call the temple a monument to India's eroding secularism.

SUMMARY: Photos from Israel and Gaza show some of what the past week has looked like for people on the ground there as the conflict enters its fourth month.

TITLE: TikTok cuts jobs as tech layoffs continue to mount
SUMMARY: The wildly popular video-sharing app is the latest technology firm to reduce staff in response to what executives say are ongoing business challenges.

TITLE: Authorities searching for a suspect in the shooting deaths of 8 people near Chicago
SUMMARY: The victims were found Sunday and Monday at three separate locations. Police said they did not know of a motive for the killings, but said the suspect knew the victims.

TITLE: The U.S. and U.K. bomb more Houthi sites in Yemen
SUMMARY: The U.S. and U.K. said they used warship- and submarine-launched Tomahawk missiles and fighter jets to take out Houthi missile storage sites, drones and launchers.

SUMMARY: Voting concludes Tuesday in New Hampshire's first-in-the-nation presidential primary election. View the live results.

TITLE: A school in Jerusalem brings Arab and Jewish kids together to boost understanding
SUMMARY: Jewish and Arab children learn alongside each other at the Hand in Hand school. They're taught in Hebrew and Arabic, in a program unusual in Israel for integrating students of different backgrounds.

SUMMARY: Russian missiles targeted Ukraine's two biggest cities on Tuesday morning, damaging apartment buildings and killing at least six people.

SUMMARY: In writer Tanja Maljartschuk's novel, the narrator's malaise and weakening attachment to time serve as a metaphor for today's Ukraine, as well as for other struggling democracies, including our own.

SUMMARY: Louisiana's new congressional map is a win for Black voters and likely brings an end to the state's long-running legal battle over redistricting. It could also see Democrats gain a seat in Congress.

SUMMARY: The 74-year-old singer-songwriter's longtime label, Columbia Records, plans to drop 'Turn the Lights Back On' on Feb. 1st.

SUMMARY: Israel said 21 soldiers died when two buildings exploded and collapsed; three more died fighting in southern Gaza. Israel says it's investigating the incident, which Hamas claims responsibility for.

SUMMARY: Turkish legislators endorsed Sweden's membership in NATO, lifting a major hurdle on the previously nonaligned country's entry into the military alliance.

SUMMARY: Osgood, who anchored CBS Sunday Morning for more than two decades and hosted the long-running radio program The Osgood File,

SUMMARY: The U.S. Department of Education says it will fix a mistake that would have hurt low-income students, lowering their financial aid<em>.

SUMMARY: In 2023, union membership grew, but the share of the U.S. workforce that's unionized declined from the year before due to even faster growth in nonunion jobs.

SUMMARY: The 4-year-old giraffe arrived Tuesday at his new home in a large animal park in central Mexico. He was transferred following pressure from animal advocates, and after he spent the last year alone.

TITLE: Biden wins the New Hampshire primary after Democrats write him on the ballot
SUMMARY: President Biden wasn't on the ballot after the Democratic Party changed its rules to side-step New Hampshire. But the state's party establishment rallied to write his name in, anyway.

SUMMARY: Donald Trump's decisive victory in the New Hampshire primary puts him on a clear path to securing the Republican nomination. It is also likely to fuel calls for Nikki Haley to drop out of the race.

SUMMARY: The e-commerce company is the latest in a wave of tech firms that have slashed thousands of jobs in just the first four weeks of the year.

SUMMARY: The penalties for performance-enhancing drug use in the NBA are a 25-game suspension for the first offense, a 55-game suspension for the second offense and dismissal from the NBA on the third offense.

SUMMARY: More than three months into Israel's war in Gaza, the economy of the West Bank is reeling. Many fear the economic pain may lead to even more violence in the territory.

SUMMARY: Hedge fund boss Bill Ackman has fought bitter battles in corporate boardrooms. He fights with lengthy public letters and for years. He's taking those tactics to Ivy League universities and the media.

TITLE: Religious 'Nones' are now the largest single group in the U.S.

SUMMARY: Voting concludes Tuesday in New Hampshire's first-in-the-nation presidential primary election. Stream NPR's live audio coverage starting at 7 p.m. ET.

TITLE: 'Barbie' receives 8 Oscar nominations, but was that Kenough?

TITLE: Raped, pregnant and in an abortion ban state? Researchers gauge how often it happens

TITLE: EBay to lay off 1,000 workers as tech job losses continue in the new year
SUMMARY: The e-commerce company is the latest in a wave of tech firms that have slashed thousands of jobs in just the first four weeks of the year.

TITLE: NPR names tech executive Katherine Maher to lead in turbulent era
SUMMARY: Incoming NPR CEO Katherine Maher has a background in tech and world affairs. She says the network's mission fits neatly with her advocacy of the free flow of information in expanding democracy.

TITLE: Amateur archaeologists uncover a mysterious ancient Roman artifact in England
SUMMARY: More than 100 of these artifacts have been found across Europe, but no one knows what they were used for. This dodecahedron was discovered fully intact and in excellent condition.

TITLE: Nearly 1.9 million Ford Explorers are being recalled over an insecure piece of trim
SUMMARY: The National Highway Traffic Safety Administration said a detached piece of trim on the SUVs could become a "road hazard" and increase the risk of a crash.

TITLE: Oregon jury awards $85 million to 9 victims of deadly 2020 wildfires
SUMMARY: The verdict comes in a series of legal proceedings that are expected to put the utility PacifiCorp on the hook for billions of dollars over its liability for the blazes.

TITLE: The malaria vaccine that just rolled out has a surprise benefit for kids

TITLE: Jon Stewart will return to 'The Daily Show' as a weekly guest host

SUMMARY: The now-former head of the state's Republican Party accused Lake of leaking a recording in which he offers compensation if she will take "a pause for a couple of years" from running for public office.

TITLE: 4 things to know about Elise Stefanik, as VP rumors swirl
SUMMARY: Just a few years ago, Stefanik was rated the 13th most bipartisan House member. She also differed from Trump on several key issues — but times have changed.

TITLE: Arno Penzias, co-discoverer of the Big Bang's afterglow, dies at age 90
SUMMARY: Penzias, with his colleague Robert Woodrow Wilson, discovered the cosmic microwave background while working at Bell Labs in the 1960s. The finding was the smoking gun evidence for the Big Bang.

TITLE: Boeing's quality control draws criticism as a whistleblower alleges lapses at factory

SUMMARY: Most of the country's other big unions endorsed President Biden in the earliest days of his reelection campaign. But the United Auto Workers held back until today.

TITLE: With Pitchfork in peril, a word on the purpose of music journalism
SUMMARY: At its best, the influential online music pub — which Condé Nast announced last week will be folded into <em>GQ

TITLE: After seeming to bribe Senate hopeful Kari Lake not to run, Arizona GOP Chair resigns
SUMMARY: The now-former head of the state's Republican Party accused Lake of leaking a recording in which he offers compensation if she will take "a pause for a couple of years" from running for public office.

TITLE: Nearly 1.9 million Ford Explorers are being recalled over an unsecured piece of trim
SUMMARY: The National Highway Traffic Safety Administration said a detached piece of trim on the SUVs could become a "road hazard" and increase the risk of a crash.

TITLE: Gene therapy shows promise for an inherited form of deafness
SUMMARY: Scientists report that gene therapy restored at least some hearing and speech for five out of six children with a rare form of genetic deafness.

TITLE: 6 bodies are found at a remote Mojave Desert crossroads
SUMMARY: Authorities were still gathering evidence to determine what happened, and a sheriff's spokesperson said they could not say even how the people died.

TITLE: The FAA lays out a path for Boeing 737 Max 9 to fly again, but new concerns surface
SUMMARY: While the Federal Aviation Administration says the grounded 737 Max 9 aircraft can resume flying after inspections, the agency imposed sweeping jet production restrictions at Boeing factories.

TITLE: Italy's lower chamber of parliament approves deal with Albania to house migrants
SUMMARY: The proposal, which passed 155-115 with two abstentions in the Chamber of Deputies, now goes to the Senate, where Premier Giorgia Meloni's right-wing forces also have a comfortable majority.

TITLE: Regulators target fees for consumers who are denied a purchase for insufficient funds
SUMMARY: It's the latest salvo in the government's campaign against so-called "junk fees," which President Biden said last year harm "working folks" and drive up costs for consumers.

TITLE: The colonoscopies were free but the 'surgical trays' came with $600 price tags
SUMMARY: Health providers may bill however they choose, including in ways that could leave patients with unexpected bills for "free" care. Preventive care left an Illinois couple with "surgical tray" charges.

TITLE: His spacecraft sprung a leak. Then this NASA astronaut accidentally broke a record
SUMMARY: NASA astronaut Frank Rubio holds the record for the longest U.S. space flight, but he wasn't trying to earn that title.

TITLE: Japan's village with the oldest population is wooing young residents to survive
SUMMARY: Some Japanese are trying to reinvigorate their country's most aged village — where two-thirds of residents are over 65.

TITLE: So long, presidential debates? Why we may not see Trump, Biden or Haley face off
SUMMARY: The political debate seems to have become an endangered species, and there are no assurances we'll see Trump, Biden or Haley share the stage this year.

TITLE: Texas cold leaves alligators frozen underwater, but still alive. Here's how
SUMMARY: Alligators rely on external sources to regulate their body temperatures — so during winter, they will go into brumation. A viral video captured the phenomenon during the Texas winter freeze.

TITLE: Why don't GOP voters care about electability this year?
SUMMARY: Nikki Haley's pitch is that she can beat Joe Biden. But now that she's lost — twice — voters are signaling they aren't concerned about electability as much as a candidate that shares their values.

TITLE: Man is sentenced to death for arson attack at Japanese anime studio that killed 36
SUMMARY: A Japanese court sentenced a man to death after finding him guilty of murder for carrying out a shocking arson attack on an anime studio in Kyoto, Japan, that killed 36 people.

TITLE: Young voters focus more on issues than candidates in 2024 presidential election
SUMMARY: Voters under 30 tend to lean left of center overall and could make a major difference for Democratic candidates. Will they turn out in strong enough numbers to help President Biden win reelection?

TITLE: Housing is now unaffordable for a record half of all U.S. renters, study finds
SUMMARY: A new Harvard analysis finds people across income levels got squeezed by rent hikes during the pandemic. The market has lost millions of low-rent places, and new construction is mostly high-end.

TITLE: Up First briefing: Boeing faces production caps, Haley bets on South Carolina
SUMMARY: The FAA laid out a plan for Boeing 737 Max 9 jets to resume flying, but also hit the company with production caps. Former South Carolina Gov. Nikki Haley pins her presidential hopes on her home state.

TITLE: Delegate tracker: Trump leads GOP presidential candidates on road to nomination
SUMMARY: How many delegates does each candidate have in the 2024 Republican presidential nomination race? NPR keeps track.

TITLE: Criminal trial for Spain's former soccer head is proposed for his unwanted kiss
SUMMARY: A high court judge also says three men who pressured Jenni Hermoso to absolve Luis Rubiales — by acting together in an attempt "to break the will" of the star forward — could also face charges.

TITLE: A U.S. scientist's tea recipe has Brits aghast. Salt? Warm milk? The horror!
SUMMARY: Some 250 years after Americans ruined a lot of British tea in Boston Harbor, a U.S. chemist's salty tip for the perfect cup has prompted an intervention from the U.S. Embassy in London.

TITLE: Many experts feared a recession. Instead, the economy has continued to soar
SUMMARY: The U.S. economy grew substantially faster in the final months of 2023 than forecasters had expected. For all of last year, the economy grew 3.1% — defying forecasts of a likely recession.

TITLE: Bipartisan border deal at risk of collapse under pressure from Trump
SUMMARY: A bipartisan border deal is at risk after Senate Minority Leader Mitch McConnell suggested the politics around the agreement have shifted but negotiators say they are forging ahead.

TITLE: Ex-Trump adviser Peter Navarro sentenced to 4 months for contempt of Congress
SUMMARY: Former Trump White House trade adviser Peter Navarro was convicted last year for defying a subpoena from the House committee investigating the Jan. 6 Capitol attack.

TITLE: JN.1 takes over as the most prevalent COVID-19 variant. Here's what you need to know
SUMMARY: The CDC estimates that up to 86% of new COVID-19 cases stem from the latest mutation. The virus continues to evolve so rapidly that "our immune systems have not been able to keep up," an expert says.

TITLE: Trump testifies in the E. Jean Carroll trial
SUMMARY: In all, Trump spoke for less than a minute. He insisted that his previous recorded statement about the allegations was true and that he did not intend to harm her.

TITLE: Justin Timberlake teases first new album in 5 years with single 'Selfish'
SUMMARY: The Grammy Award-winner's track comes in run up to the March 15 release of his new album, <em>Everything I Thought It Was.

TITLE: Sweary parrots become unlikely stars at a British zoo ($#@%!)
SUMMARY: The profane parrots please patrons, despite the staff's fears that visitors might be scandalized from hearing so much salty language from the birds.

TITLE: Ring will no longer allow police to request users' doorbell camera footage
SUMMARY: The update is the latest restriction Ring has made to police activity on its Neighbors app following concerns raised by privacy watchdogs about the company's relationship with police departments.

TITLE: Senate border negotiations forge ahead despite pressure from Trump
SUMMARY: Senate negotiators are continuing to work on a bipartisan border deal even after Minority Leader Mitch McConnell suggested the politics around the agreement have shifted.

TITLE: GM's driverless car company Cruise is under investigation by several agencies
SUMMARY: Cruise hired a law firm to investigate the start-up's interactions with regulators after a Cruise vehicle dragged a pedestrian on October 2. Multiple government agencies are now examining the crash.

TITLE: NASA retires Ingenuity, the little helicopter that made history on Mars
SUMMARY: Seventy-two flights later, the small-but-mighty helicopter's time has come to an end after it was damaged during a test flight last week.

TITLE: Alabama executes man by nitrogen gas for the first time in the U.S.
SUMMARY: Kenneth Smith, 58, died at 8:25 pm Thursday night, after a slew of last minute appeals to several courts, including the U.S. Supreme Court, failed.

TITLE: Voting begins in tiny Tuvalu in election that reverberates from China to Australia
SUMMARY: The elections come as China, the U.S. and others wrangle for influence in the South Pacific region. Tuvalu is one of 12 countries that have official diplomatic relations with Taiwan.

TITLE: New gene-editing tools may help wipe out mosquito-borne diseases
SUMMARY: Scientists say gene-editing technology may eradicate a mosquito in the U.S. that spreads dengue and other diseases. Concerns remain about the possible environmental impact of bioengineered mosquitoes.

TITLE: From a winningest coach to a losingest Oscar hopeful — it's the weekly news quiz
SUMMARY: This week, a man got something that a woman worked hard for. A noisy scourge will be unavoidable in the coming months. And a poll showed Americans have lost faith in power. So, the usual.

TITLE: War in Gaza opens scars for Palestinians in Lebanon, firming up support for Hamas
SUMMARY: In Beirut's Shatila refugee camp, Palestinian refugees say they support Hamas' fight for their homeland.

TITLE: Friendly fire and accidents have killed a lot of Israeli soldiers in Gaza. Here's why
SUMMARY: Nearly 1 in 5 Israeli casualties since the invasion of Gaza were caused by friendly fire or accidents. Experts say it's one of the highest such percentages in recent military history.

TITLE: The 'mob wife' aesthetic is in. But what about the vintage fur that comes with it?
SUMMARY: The "mob wife" look calls for flashy gold jewelry, big sunglasses — and fur coats. Some people are turning to vintage furs as a sustainable option, but critics say it isn't an ethical workaround.

TITLE: To help these school kids deal with trauma, mindfulness lessons over the loudspeaker
SUMMARY: An elementary school in Florida, credits daily mindfulness lessons with helping students cope with stress — and turning the school around academically. The lessons are delivered through an app.

TITLE: That giant extinct shark, Megalodon? Maybe it wasn't so mega
SUMMARY: The ancient extinct shark that starred in the film <em>The Meg

TITLE: The long and bitter relationship between Israel's Benjamin Netanyahu and Hamas
SUMMARY: Israeli leader Benjamin Netanyahu and Hamas have a tortured relationship dating back to the 1990s. Yet at various times, the hardline policies of one have boosted the other.

TITLE: 'It felt like my head burst': Survivors recount attack on U.N. facility
SUMMARY: Some of the people injured from this week's attack on a United Nations training facility in Khan Younis are receiving treatment in Rafah.

TITLE: Up First Briefing: ICJ finds Gaza genocide case 'plausible'; bipartisan border deal
SUMMARY: The U.N.'s top court is issuing an interim order on the genocide case against Israel. A bipartisan Senate deal pairing border security with aid for Ukraine and Israel could fall through.

TITLE: U.N. court says Gaza genocide is 'plausible,' but does not order cease-fire
SUMMARY: The International Court of Justice ordered Israel to ensure its military does not take actions that violate the Genocide Convention, but did not call for a cease-fire.

TITLE: Here's how to tell if your next flight is on a Boeing 737 Max 9
SUMMARY: After a green light from the FAA, the Max 9 is set to return to the skies. Here's what travelers need to know about the plane after a terrifying scene on an Alaska Airlines flight earlier this month.

TITLE: 'Hot droughts' are becoming more common in the arid West, new study finds
SUMMARY: Scientists looked at trees to better understand the interplay between temperatures and droughts in the Western U.S. Human-caused climate change is exacerbating both.

TITLE: King Charles III 'doing well' after scheduled prostate treatment, Queen Camilla says
SUMMARY: The 75-year-old British monarch is doing well after undergoing a "corrective procedure" for an enlarged prostate, Queen Camilla said Friday as she left the private hospital where he was being treated.

TITLE: U.N. agency in Gaza fires employees over alleged involvement in Oct. 7 attack
SUMMARY: The U.N. has announced it has launched an investigation into the allegations. The U.S., which said 12 employees were involved, said it would pause funding to UNRWA, which provides aid to Palestinians.

TITLE: A top U.N. court says Gaza genocide is 'plausible,' but does not order cease-fire
SUMMARY: The International Court of Justice ordered Israel to ensure its military does not take actions that violate the Genocide Convention, but did not call for a cease-fire.

TITLE: A top U.N. court says Gaza genocide is 'plausible' but does not order cease-fire
SUMMARY: The International Court of Justice ordered Israel to ensure its military does not take actions that violate the Genocide Convention, but the court did not call for a cease-fire.

TITLE: A dip in unauthorized border crossings has left a California migrant encampment empty
SUMMARY: The community of Jacumba, in California, has been overwhelmed with migrant encampments — as many as a thousand people in dire humanitarian conditions. A few weeks ago, locals say, something changed.

TITLE: Jury orders Trump to pay $83 million for defaming columnist E. Jean Carroll
SUMMARY: This is the second time Trump has been ordered pay Carroll. Last year he was mandated by a jury to pay $5 million for a separate instance of defamation.

TITLE: Deepfakes exploiting Taylor Swift images exemplify a scourge with little oversight
SUMMARY: Bogus pornographic images purporting to show pop superstar Taylor Swift have emerged on social media, highlighting a growing challenge to privacy rights.

TITLE: Wrestling icon Vince McMahon resigns from WWE parent company after sex abuse suit
SUMMARY: Wrestling icon Vince McMahon resigned Friday from WWE's parent company the day after a former employee filed a federal lawsuit accusing him and another former executive of serious sexual misconduct.

TITLE: Jackie Robinson statue was stolen from a Kansas park
SUMMARY: A prized statue of Jackie Robinson was stolen from a public park in Kansas, spurring a police search and outrage across the city of Wichita.

TITLE: Haitians are desperate after Kenyan court blocks police force deployment
SUMMARY: Uncertainty have been spreading since Friday's ruling, blocking the deployment of a U.N.-backed police force, with violence reaching new records as gangs tighten their grip on Haiti's capital.

TITLE: Yemen Houthi rebels fire a missile at a U.S. warship, escalating Mideast conflict
SUMMARY: Houthi rebels launched a missile Friday at a United States warship patrolling the Gulf of Aden. Early Saturday, U.S. forces conducted a strike against a Houthi anti-ship missile.

TITLE: International Holocaust Remembrance Day rings differently this year
SUMMARY: Holocaust Remembrance Day, Jan. 27, feels different this year because of the Oct. 7 Hamas attack on Israel. More Jews were killed that day than on any single day since the Holocaust.

TITLE: An ancient Egyptian temple in New York inspires a Lebanese American musician
SUMMARY: H. Sinno, former lead singer of the pioneering Lebanese rock band Mashrou' Leila, pairs their own history with that of the Metropolitan Museum's Temple of Dendur in their new opera.

TITLE: A California community sees a dip in immigration. Where have all the people gone?
SUMMARY: The town of Jacumba, on the California-Mexico border, has experienced a massive influx of migrants. Unofficial detention camps have popped up throughout the community. Then one day, something changed.

TITLE: Hollywood has been giving out climate change-focused awards for 33 years. Who knew?
SUMMARY: Now in its 33rd year, the Environmental Media Awards might be the most celebrity-studded awards ceremony you've never heard of.

TITLE: They watched 2 election workers face abuse, and it's compelling them to serve in 2024
SUMMARY: Even though two 2020 election workers in Fulton County, Ga., endured an onslaught of threats and harassment following baseless fraud claims, people there are eager to serve as poll workers this year.

SUMMARY: Russia recruits Nepali men with promises of citizenship and enticing wages. But after news of at least 10 Nepali troops killed, Nepal's government and families want to bring their soldiers home.

TITLE: The Boeing 737 Max 9 takes off again, but the company faces more turbulence ahead
SUMMARY: The first 737 Max 9 planes have started flying again after a fuselage panel blew off in midair last week. But industry analysts say Boeing's reputation will take a lot longer to repair.

TITLE: Early polls don't always foretell the fate of a first-term president. Does anything?
SUMMARY: If polls are not perfect predictors of an incumbent's reelection, is there something else that is? Observers have long sought the True North by which to set their compass and their expectations.

TITLE: Patients say keto helps with their mental illness. Science is racing to understand why
SUMMARY: It's not just for weight loss. Patients and doctors alike are having success using the diet for illnesses like bipolar disorder and schizophrenia. And research is taking off.

TITLE: Her son was taken by Hamas. She threw him a concert in the hopes he could hear it
SUMMARY: Alon Ohel was taken in the early hours of Oct. 7. He is a talented pianist, and his mother believes that music can keep them connected: "It's not the hearing — it's the vibe, it's the energy."

TITLE: A prison art show at Lincoln's Cottage critiques presidents' penal law past
SUMMARY: <em>Prison Reimagined: Presidential Portrait Project

TITLE: Gaza's largest remaining hospital is near collapse, Doctors Without Borders says
SUMMARY: Gaza's largest remaining hospital in Khan Younis can no longer provide critical medical aid to Palestinians, the medical charity group says.

TITLE: Crew extinguishes fire on oil tanker hit by Houthi missile off Yemen coast
SUMMARY: The tanker carried Russian-produced naphtha, a flammable oil, drawing Moscow further into a conflict that so far it had blamed on the U.S.

TITLE: The State Department allows the sale of F-16 jets to Turkey to move forward
SUMMARY: The sale of the 40 F-16 fighter jets and upgrades to dozens of other jets became linked to Sweden's accession to NATO, after Turkey had objected.

TITLE: JoJo Siwa will replace Nigel Lythgoe as a judge on 'So You Think You Can Dance'
SUMMARY: The TV personality<em>

TITLE: How a West Bank Palestinian theater went from symbol of hope to casualty of war
SUMMARY: Jenin's Freedom Theatre was ransacked by Israeli soldiers, its staff thrown in jail. Once celebrated as a peace initiative, it's the latest casualty of near-daily military raids on the West Bank.

TITLE: Nearly 25,000 tech workers were laid in the first weeks of 2024. What's going on?
SUMMARY: Silicon Valley executives have said the cuts are a result of pandemic overhiring and still-historically-high inflation. But others say something else may be behind the mass layoffs.

TITLE: The Pro Volleyball Federation for women debuts and draws a record crowd.
SUMMARY: It's a new league and a new era for women's volleyball. The Pro Volleyball Federation held its first match in Nebraska.  The seven team league will add three more teams in 2025.

TITLE: House Democratic candidates make abortion access top focus of '24 campaigns
SUMMARY: Democrats are targeting seats with first-term GOP incumbents in states where access to abortion rights could resonate with swing voters.

TITLE: Finns go to polls to elect new president, at unprecedented time for NATO newcomer
SUMMARY: Voters in Finland were electing a new president Sunday at an unprecedented time for the Nordic nation that is now a NATO member with its eastern border with Russia closed.

TITLE: Iran launches three satellites into space as tensions rise
SUMMARY: Iran says it successfully launched three satellites into space with a rocket that had multiple failures in the past, the latest for a program that the West says improves Tehran's ballistic missiles.

TITLE: Ukraine says corrupt officials stole $40 million meant to buy arms for the war
SUMMARY: Employees from a Ukrainian arms firm conspired with defense ministry officials to embezzle almost $40 million earmarked to buy shells for the war with Russia, Ukraine's security service reported.

TITLE: What to know about the NFL conference championship games
SUMMARY: The victors of Sunday's games will face each another in the Super Bowl. It's the Baltimore Ravens versus the Kansas City Chiefs and, later, the San Francisco 49ers against the Detroit Lions.

TITLE: Greyhound stations were once a big part of America. Now, many of them are being shut
SUMMARY: Greyhound bus stations are being shut down and redeveloped. The closures are leaving passengers without a warm place to get a snack, use the restroom or wait for the bus.

TITLE: Climate activists throw soup at glass protecting Mona Lisa in Paris
SUMMARY: Two climate activists hurled soup Sunday at the glass protecting the Mona Lisa at the Louvre Museum in Paris and shouted slogans advocating for a sustainable food system.

TITLE: Nearly 25,000 tech workers were laid off in 2024's first weeks. What's happening?
SUMMARY: Silicon Valley executives have said the cuts are a result of pandemic overhiring and still-historically-high inflation. But others say something else may be behind the mass layoffs.

TITLE: Nearly 25,000 tech workers were laid off in the first weeks of 2024. Why is that?
SUMMARY: Silicon Valley executives have said the cuts are a result of pandemic overhiring and still-historically-high inflation. But others say something else may be behind the mass layoffs.

TITLE: House GOP releases impeachment articles in bid to oust Homeland Security's Mayorkas
SUMMARY: Republicans contend Mayorkas' "willful and systemic refusal to comply with the law" on immigration amounts to "high crimes and misdemeanors" for failing to manage the U.S.-Mexico border.

TITLE: The Pro Volleyball Federation for women debuts and draws a record crowd
SUMMARY: It's a new league and a new era for women's volleyball. The Pro Volleyball Federation held its first match in Nebraska.  The seven team league will add three more teams in 2025.

TITLE: Gaza puppeteer doesn't let the war stop his passion
SUMMARY: Yousef al-Hindi, a puppeteer from Gaza, continues his passion despite the war between Israel and Hamas by using whatever materials he can find.

TITLE: 3 U.S. troops were killed and 25 wounded in a drone strike on a base in Jordan
SUMMARY: The White House says Iran-backed militant groups are behind the attack. It comes amid the conflict in the Middle East that the U.S. has been working to keep from spreading through the region.

TITLE: 3 U.S. troops were killed and 34 wounded in a drone strike on a base in Jordan
SUMMARY: A coalition of militias backed by Iran claimed credit for the attack. It comes amid the conflict in the Middle East that the U.S. has been working to keep from spreading throughout the region.

TITLE: NATO newcomer Finland's presidential election is headed for a runoff
SUMMARY: Ex-Prime Minister Alexander Stubb, who represents the conservative National Coalition Party, will face former Foreign Minister Pekka Haavisto, who is making his third run for the office, on Feb. 11.

TITLE: Biden vows to respond after 3 U.S. troops were killed and 34 wounded in a drone attack
SUMMARY: A coalition of militias backed by Iran claimed credit for the attack on a base in Jordan. It comes amid the conflict in the Middle East that the U.S. has been working to keep from spreading.

TITLE: Pelosi accuses some protesters demanding Gaza cease-fire of having ties to Russia
SUMMARY: The former House speaker on Sunday suggested that some anti-war protesters are connected to Russian President Vladimir Putin, without offering evidence. She wants the FBI to investigate the matter.

TITLE: The Kansas City Chiefs will play the San Francisco 49ers in the Super Bowl
SUMMARY: It's the Chiefs' fourth trip to the big game in five seasons. The 49ers, who haven't won a Super Bowl since 1995, lost their last chance at the trophy in 2020 against the Chiefs.

TITLE: Iran launches 3 satellites into space as tensions rise
SUMMARY: Iran says it successfully launched three satellites into space with a rocket that had multiple failures in the past, the latest for a program that the West says improves Tehran's ballistic missiles.

TITLE: The IRS is piloting new software that could let you file your taxes for free
SUMMARY: Direct File will be open only to people with certain tax situations living in certain states at the outset. The free service has been criticized by Republicans and tax preparation companies.

TITLE: Scientists can tell how fast you're aging. Now, the trick is to slow it down
SUMMARY: Longevity research is booming. Scientists are looking for ways to target the basic biology of aging. And here's the exciting part: Our biological age appears to be malleable.

TITLE: Demand for minerals sparks fear of mining abuses on Indigenous peoples' lands
SUMMARY: There's a growing demand for minerals as the world ramps up manufacturing of climate solutions. Experts say more than half of these mining projects are on or near lands of Indigenous peoples.

TITLE: Hong Kong court orders China's Evergrande, which owes $300 billion, to liquidate
SUMMARY: China Evergrande is one of the biggest Chinese developers that have collapsed under pressure to rein in surging debt the ruling Communist Party views as a threat to China's slowing economic growth.

TITLE: A secret shelf of banned books thrives in a Texas school, under the nose of censors
SUMMARY: A teacher at a public school near Houston has a secret classroom bookshelf largely made up of challenged titles. Many of the books deal with race, sex and gender.

TITLE: Up First briefing: Strike kills U.S. troops in Jordan; Israel-Hamas talks continue
SUMMARY: President Biden vows to respond after a drone strike linked to Iran killed three U.S. troops and wounded dozens in Jordan. Hamas and Israel are negotiating a deal to free hostages and pause fighting.

TITLE: Sports tribunal bans Russian Kamila Valieva from figure skating through 2025
SUMMARY: Nearly two years after the Beijing Winter Olympics, an international sports tribunal says Russian Kamila Valieva  "committed an anti-doping rule violation." The U.S. could now receive a gold medal.

TITLE: The Japanese moon lander gets back to work after the sun reaches its solar panels
SUMMARY: A Japanese moon explorer is up and running Monday after several tense days without the sunlight it needs to generate power.

TITLE: U.S. charges 3 for alleged murder-for-hire plot to kill Iranian defector in Maryland
SUMMARY: The indictment unsealed in federal court is at least the third Iran-based murder-for-hire plot prosecuted by the Justice Department since 2022.

TITLE: In 'Martyr!,' an endless quest for purpose in a world that can be cruel and uncaring
SUMMARY: Engaging and wildly entertaining, Kaveh Akbar's debut novel will undoubtedly be considered one of the best of the year because it focuses on very specific stories while discussing universal feelings.

TITLE: Amelia Earhart's long-lost plane possibly spotted in the Pacific by exploration team
SUMMARY: Deep Sea Vision says its sonar image equipment spotted an object in the Pacific Ocean that closely resembles the shape and size of Amelia Earhart's aircraft.

TITLE: An Alex Murdaugh juror says the court clerk made him seem guilty before he testified
SUMMARY: The South Carolina attorney is appealing his conviction of killing his wife and son, arguing that the clerk of court's comments to jurors influenced their decision.

TITLE: A Florida park just saw a record number of manatees gather together in its waters
SUMMARY: Nearly 1,000 manatees gathered at Blue Spring State Park on one of the coldest winter days of the season. Here's why the growing number of manatees at the park is encouraging.

TITLE: Photos of life in war: Palestinians flee south in Gaza, Israel mourns dead soldiers
SUMMARY: Last week, Israel saw its deadliest day during its war with Hamas, and displaced Palestinians fled Khan Younis and headed toward a flooded Rafah, where shelter and resources remain scarce.

TITLE: The killing of U.S. troops in Jordan raises specter of a wider war in the Middle East
SUMMARY: An escalation of violence in the Middle East over the last 24 hours, including a drone attack that killed three U.S. service members, has raised concerns about the possibility of a regional war.

TITLE: Pennsylvania high court revives a case challenging Medicaid limits for abortions
SUMMARY: The court's 3-2 decision overturns a decision to dismiss the case and puts aside a 1985 state Supreme Court decision that upheld a law banning the use of state Medicaid dollars for abortion.

TITLE: Alex Murdaugh is denied a new trial after a judge hears jury tampering allegations
SUMMARY: The South Carolina attorney appealed his conviction of killing his wife and son, arguing that the clerk of court's comments to jurors influenced their decision.

TITLE: 5 people have been arrested in California desert killings, sheriff's department says
SUMMARY: The suspects were arrested after deputies served search warrants on Sunday. "We are confident that this appears to be a dispute over marijuana," a sheriff's department spokesperson said.

TITLE: Ex-IRS contractor sentenced to 5 years in prison for leaking Trump's tax records
SUMMARY: Charles Edward Littlejohn of Washington, D.C., gave data to The New York Times and ProPublica between 2018 and 2020 in leaks that appeared to be "unparalleled in the IRS's history," prosecutors said.

TITLE: The war in Gaza is leading to deep divisions at Israeli universities
SUMMARY: With Arab students suspended for social media posts, it's "the first time we see this large amount of disciplinary procedures against students for expressing themselves," says a civil rights attorney.

TITLE: Rabbis offer pastoral care for those traumatized by Oct. 7 Hamas attack
SUMMARY: The Oct. 7 attacks on Israel displaced tens of thousands of Israelis from their kibbutzim near Gaza. Since then, rabbis have been crisscrossing the country offering trauma-informed care to victims.

TITLE: Here's what to know about the collapse of China's Evergrande property developer
SUMMARY: In 2018, Evergrande was listed as the world's most valuable real estate company. But on Monday, a Hong Kong court ordered it to be liquidated.

TITLE: A stranger in Nairobi 'sowed a seed of kindness' that he carries with him today
SUMMARY: Biar Kon tells the story of a woman's act of generosity when he was 17, which inspired him to help someone else in the U.S. five years later.

TITLE: A sex educator on the one question she is asked the most: 'Am I normal?'
SUMMARY: Emily Nagoski is a sex educator and author of a bestseller on enhancing your sex life. The book did so well that it got in the way of her own.

TITLE: The ketamine economy: New mental health clinics are a 'Wild West' with few rules
SUMMARY: Ketamine, approved as an anesthetic in 1970, is emerging as a major alternative mental health treatment. But more than 500 clinics have popped up with little regulation, and treatment varies widely.

TITLE: A luxury Dior handbag rattles South Korea's politics
SUMMARY: A gift accepted by the country's first lady has set off very public debates about ethics and revealed ruling party divisions just weeks before legislative elections.

TITLE: The Olympics will begin awarding medals to runner-ups after the Kamila Valieva ban
SUMMARY: The Court for Arbitration of Sport ruled that Russian figure skater Kamila Valieva, 15, violated doping rules during the 2022 Winter Olympics and temporarily banned her from international competition.

TITLE: In the battle over identity, a centuries-old issue looms in Taiwan: hunting
SUMMARY: Taiwan has endured colonial forces over centuries. The island's Indigenous people have borne the brunt of this violent history and are still fighting for inclusion and acceptance.

TITLE: Sir Elton John and Bernie Taupin win the 2024 Gershwin Prize for Popular Song
SUMMARY: One of the most prestigious awards in American music, the Gershwin Prize recognizes musicians with a lifetime of contributions to popular songs. This year's winners are Elton John and Bernie Taupin.

TITLE: Israeli forces raid a West Bank hospital, killing three Palestinians
SUMMARY: Israel says the men who were killed on Tuesday were militants. The hospital says its CCTV footage shows Israeli forces dressed as Arab civilians and hospital staff during the raid in Jenin.

TITLE: Up First briefing: Qatar's PM visits D.C.; Texas border control dispute escalates
SUMMARY: Qatar's prime minister warns of "boiling" Middle East tensions on a visit to D.C. There's a growing dispute in Texas over whether state or federal agents have authority over immigration enforcement.

TITLE: After Russian doping decision, the U.S. suddenly has 9 new Olympic golden medalists
SUMMARY: A doping ruling Monday cleared the way for the International Olympic Committee to award U.S. athletes their first-ever team gold medal in figure skating for their performance in Beijing in 2022.

TITLE: Hey lil' goat, can you tell the difference between a happy voice and an angry voice?
SUMMARY: Dogs tune into the tone of human voices. Do livestock? To find out, goatologists ran an experiment using a hidden speaker that broadcast two versions of the phrase "Hey, look over here."

TITLE: Former Pakistani PM Imran Khan gets another prison sentence ahead of elections
SUMMARY: A Pakistani court convicted Khan of revealing official secrets and sentenced him to 10 years — the latest in a slew of legal cases that supporters say are meant to sideline the imprisoned politician.

TITLE: The IRS got $80B to help people and chase rich tax avoiders. Here's how it's going
SUMMARY: Commissioner Danny Werfel says the IRS is seeing "very powerful early results" in its efforts to improve enforcement on high wealth is paying off.

TITLE: Why do moths fly in circles around a light? They can't tell 'up' from 'down'
SUMMARY: Those insects you see flying in crazed circles are trying to keep their backs towards the light because they think that direction is up, new research suggests.

TITLE: UPS is cutting 12,000 jobs just months after reaching union deal
SUMMARY: UPS will cut 12,000 jobs and released a revenue outlook for this year that sent its shares down sharply. CEO Carol Tome said that the job cuts will produce $1 billion in cost savings.

TITLE: House GOP prepares to impeach Homeland Security chief over handling of U.S. border
SUMMARY: Republicans on the Committee are expected to approve the articles along party lines on Tuesday, setting up a vote on the full House floor as early as this week.

TITLE: Another Super Bowl bet emerges: Can Taylor Swift make it from her Tokyo show in time?
